data.title: Old fashion hamburgers
data.text: I haven't been to Clarke's in ages but was able to stop by to get one of their Clarke's burgers with fries. It was as good as ever and I am glad I stopped off to try one again.

data.title: OMG! Burgers and shakes to die for!
data.text:
On El Camino Real in Mountain View.  Don't miss the chance to taste the best burgers and shakes on the planet.

Unassuming, reserved, you'll drive by if you're not 'in the know'.  It looks like a dive, because it has a loyal, local following that loves great burgers and shakes.

My weakness is a traditional cheeseburger, with cheddar, and a vanilla malt.  No bacon, no guacamole, or barbque sauce for me, although they have those, and more!

Simple. Perfection.  

Don't drive by and miss your chance...

data.title: Burgers as Comfort Food
data.text: Needed a quick dinner after a long flight. Chose Clarke's based on reputation as best burgers in Mountain View. The atmosphere is very basic with nothing fancy. Order at a counter, pick up order when your name is called. Burgers come with a tomato slice other toppings and condiments on a condiment bar. We all had 8 oz cheese burgers - each was hot with the cheese nicely melted. Had a hearty taste from the searing on the grill. The fries were hot and firm with a nice taste.  The burgers were very good and reminded me of how poor the fast food offerings really are. Clarke's burgers are the real deal.

data.title: The smell hits you first
data.text:
The first thing I noticed when I pulled into this place was an amazing smell.  It was open-flamed goodness drawing unsuspecting passersby in like only the Pied Piper could.  Very excited at this point. 

The good... The burgers were appropriately sized and I loved the dress-it-yourself bar for all the onions, jalapeños and pickles anyone could want.  I really enjoyed the bun as it was very soft, but held together nicely.  Maybe the patty could have used a pinch of salt, but otherwise it was a great diner-type burger.  Oh, and the serving of bacon was portioned quite generously.  A very good burger experience, indeed. The onion rings were extremely high on my list....crispy, tender and soft in all the right places...excellent!  

The okay... Not much detail necessary, but the fried zucchini and potato wedges were...well, just okay. 

The bad... The prices were a bit high...80 bucks for my family at a walk-up diner joint? Seems like a lot.  I also don't like that I'm basically eating at McDonald's, in terms of service, but they have a tip line on the credit card slip.  I hate that because I always feel inclined to tip.  I know...that's why they do it...but that's also why I say shame on them.  They should care enough about me as the customer to treat me right the whole process through.  That means not trying to intimidate/shame me into tipping.  I know...my fault, but still they could make the right call and get rid of it.  I mean they do nothing but take your order and call your number.  Weak!  Also, they had a frequent-burger card at the counter.  I ordered three adult burgers (and four kids burgers) which should count for three "markings" on my card.  They gave me two. I didn't say anything, because I'm not gonna be petty about it...but they certainly were.  I paid 80 bucks, I tipped nicely, and you couldn't make it your priority to make sure it was handled accurately.  That feels cheap to me.  The lady kind of gave me an uncomfortable look after...I could tell she was wondering if I'd call her out.  That's the only reason I'm writing this...it was clear she did it intentionally.  Service was below par for sure.  Prices were pretty high.  

All that said, if I find myself in the area again, forget the service I'll go back for that righteous aroma and killer open flamed burger.

data.title: Unique Mountain View Classic
data.text: Old time burger joint.  Hamburgers and ribs are fantastic.  Building is very casual.  Love the garlic fries, sweet potato fries, and onion rings.  In door, out door seating that is rustic and cozy.  Friendly staff.

data.title: Best Hamburgers in Santa Clara County
data.text: I enjoy a hamburger about once a quarter.  I've checked out places they never measure up to Clarke's.  You get a large hamburger and can add any extra ingredients.  This place is always busy, inside or outside.  This place is a landmark in Mt. View, they have been in Mt. View for at least 50 years.

data.title: Mountain View Classic
data.text:
Clarke's has been at this location since 1950's and we have been coming here for years.  I am not a burger person but my husband is a Clarke diehard.  The decor is not fancy; a old craftsman house converted into a restaurant with booth seating.  The smell of years of grilling burger penetrates every single nooks of this place.  
The burger is made of quality meat and no frill.  A big condiment bar for whatever you want to add.  Compared to In'n Out, the burger here has a slight smoky flavor.  If you like to build your own burger, don't waste your time at the Counter, come here instead.

data.title: Great Funky Burger Place
data.text: Clarke's was a great find on our last trip to the Bay Area.  We were looking for lunch before a hike, and found this on Google Maps (usually not helpful).  We got there just as they opened at 11:00.  The cheeseburger was excellent:  cooked exactly right and TASTY.  I don't know why that should be something exceptional, but I don't know how many times I'm spent $10 for a burger that tastes meh!  I'm not talking about the crap you put on the burger, but the meat itself.  It should TASTE GOOD!!!  And it does at Clarke's.  The malt was OK, but the fries were very good.  The place had a cool hippy vibe that really made us feel at home.  I have family in the area, so we'll be back.

data.title: There Simply Aren't Places Like This Anymore
data.text:
After eating at Clarkes tonight, I went to their website.  Their homepage says, in part, "Our friendly staff will cook your food to perfection at which time you can put any number of toppings on yourself..."  I did my best to put my toppings on my burger, still I ended up getting a lot of them on myself!  So it goes,

I'm no spring chicken and I can remember when there would be places like this along-side the "main roads" on the outskirts of towns.  I remember stopping sometimes with my parents and sister.  By the time I was 10 or so, the outskirts were more frequently viewed from the freeway and no one ever stopped anymore.

Yes, this place is a true relic.  It is so unassuming that, if my wife had not spotted it, I would have driven right by.  That would have been a tragedy.

When we walked in and went to the central counter to order, I felt like I was about 4 1/2 feet tall again.  ("Dad, can we get milkshakes?")  The nostalgia is real, not pre-packaged.  It simply is what the place is.

So, on to the food:

My wife and I both got burgers and what burgers they were!  They are seared over real charcoal--crisp and charred on the outside and moist and tasty inside.  You can taste the quality of the meat which they grind themselves.  There are lots of condiments to choose from (and put on yourself, if you must) and everything is quality.

We also tried the Potato Gems and Onion Rings.  The Gems are thick cut potato wedges served with sour cream--wonderful!  The Onion Rings are home made, breaded not battered and cooked perfectly.

We left with milkshakes to drink on the way home--peanut butter and cherry--not combined.  The shakes are made with "real" hard ice cream and this makes a big difference.

The "main route" (old Highway 101) is long gone and two little towns have grown up to become small cities engulfing this little hold-over.  People know a good thing though and it is popular.

I suggest to travelers to seek out this little diamond in the rough.  You will find good food and, perhaps, a memory or two.  It will take you away from the freeway and isn't that how we really get to see things?

PS:  They also serve dinner plates of BBQ chicken and pork ribs.  Other patrons recommended both.  This sounds like a good reason to go back soon!

data.title: GRILLED GREAT BERGERS
data.text: lots of great addons and very fresh you do yourself. with very good and a generous amount of fries. Have never been disappointed since 1956 after my brothers baseball games.

data.title: Always dependable
data.text: I have been coming her for over 45 years and have never been disappointed in the food or the service.. All the burgers meat or Chicken are very good and cooked the way you want. they also serve breakfast and I did go once and it was good.

data.title: Good but pricy
data.text: Clare's is a fun place. The burgers and fries are yummy but they are not cheap. On the weekend they serve breakfast and that was super yummy.  Indoor and outdoor seating

data.title: Excellent Food
data.text: If you love pork ribs, this is the place to visit. Go for the dinner meal  or pork ribs and grill chicken combo alongside a can of bear and chill out :-) They serve the best pork ribs in Mountain view.

data.title: A classic, must do on bucket list!!
data.text: Charcoal broiled (really), not fried, the burgers R to die for … all condiments are DYI.  And there's plenty of other choices.

data.title: Great local burger joint
data.text:
I lived in Mountain View for 7+ years so will finally write some reviews for our go to spots.

The food here is pretty solid. Lots of choices on what to put on your burger (they also have a fixin's bar). The sweet potato fries are great as well. If you want a solid burger and don't want to hit up one of the local chains, this is the place to go.

data.title: Great Hamburgers, not much atmosphere
data.text:
My wife and I visit this place about every couple of months because the hamburgers are made to order and taste great. We also like the sweet potato fries.

There is lack of dining room space. Sometimes is it crowed and you have to share tables with people you don't know. This can be a negative or a positive experience. I have had both. You can avoid this by going at off hours (lunch during the week primarily).

data.title: What Happened to this great burger joint?
data.text: No Flavor, No Flavor, No flavorrrrrrrrr, Greasy, floppy fries. yuck, why did I finish the burger, my tummy, kids told me we should have gone to in and out, I owe them.

data.title: Charcoal grilled deliciousness!
data.text: This old fashioned burger shack has been doing it right for 70 years now (since 1945). Very gracious staff even though we arrived 15 minutes before closing on a Thursday night. Patient to take our orders even though one in our party was Slooow to decide. We all loved our burgers! Yummy, old school, & grilled to perfection with fresh serve-yourself toppings even at 8:55 pm! The guacamole (served on the side) had just the right combo of chunkiness and creaminess & just the right kick of spice. The sweet potato fries (3 of us shared a basket) were perfectly cooked - crispy & sweet w/not a bit of grease and my chocolate malt was excellent! They have Bbq dinners too which I've not yet tried. I've also come here for breakfast and it's even better! When you want what an old fashioned burger joint offers Clarke's is the place!

data.title: Overrated!
data.text: This place used to be fantastic, but in the past couple of visits the burgers seem to be getting smaller and smaller.  Though the prices are quite high.  I don't mind paying for an excellent burger, but this just isn't getting it done.  Definitely no longer my go to hamburger spot.

data.title: Best charbroiled hamburgers in Mt. View
data.text: Great burgers and plenty of add-ons to make this a more than full meal. Founded in 1945, frequented by me since 1965, friends and relatives always request that we eat at Clarke's. My favorite hangout in Mt View. Staff is very helpful, price is right and the burgers are so good.
